description: A description of the general input formatting for MoSDeN

name.description: Classifier to use in defining the MoSDeN simulation

multi_id.description: Alternative naming convention for use in multiple simulations

file_options.desription: Options relating to files and directories

overwrite.description: Classifiers for which data files to overwrite

preprocessing.description: Overwrite half-lives, fission yields, and emission probabilities

unprocessed_data_dir.description: Path to the directory storing unprocessed data

literature_data_dir.description: Path to the directory storing literature data

reprocessing_data_dir.description: Path to the directory storing chemical reprocessing data

processed_data_dir.description: Path to the directory storing the data produced after preprocessing

output_dir.description: Path to the directory where MoSDeN output is stored

log_file.description: Path to the log file where logging messages are written

data_options.description: Options regarding data and data evaluations

half_life.description: Path to the half-life unprocessed data

cross_section.description: NotImplemented: This is a placeholder for a potential improvement incorporating cross sections into the CFY concentration calculation

emission_probability.description: Path to the emission probability data

fission_yield.description: Path to the fission yield data

decay_time_spacing.description: The spacing between time nodes while the fissile sample decays

temperature_K.description: Temperature of the sample in Kelvin

density_g_cm3.description: Density of the sample in grams per centimeter cubed

energy_MeV.description: Incident neutron energy bombarding the sample

fissile_fractions.description: The fission-weighted fissile nuclides present (if using OpenMC for concentration calculation, then the weight-percent mix of fissiles should be used

additionalProperties.description: These properties should be named the fissile nuclide (such as U235) and detail the weighting as a float (e.g. 0.3)

concentration_handling.description: Method to use for concentration calculation. This include using independent fission yields (not suggested), cumulative fission yields (CFY), and OpenMC (OMC)

count_rate_handling.description: Method to use for calculating the delayed neutron count rate. This can either be from data or using existing group parameters from a MoSDeN output

reprocessing_locations.description: The locations where the reprocessing scheme provided occurs (NOTE: MoSDeN currently assumes all provided reprocessing parameters occur in the same spatial region

spatial_scaling.description: Set of booleans that inform if terms should be scaled (applied globally) or unscaled (applied locally)

flux.description: Whether or not to scale the neutron flux

reprocessing.description: Whether or not to scale the chemical reprocessing terms

base_removal_scaling.description: The chemical reprocessing terms given to MoSDeN are assumed to be scaled terms (applied to the entire volume). This term indicates the scaling applied to those terms (1.0 if unscaled terms are provided instead).

reprocessing.description: The reprocessing scheme to apply. Given in the form of elements (e.g. Xe) and their removal rates per second (e.g. 0.1).

irrad_type.description: Type of irradiation to simulate. Saturation irradiation can be used to refer to any intermediate length irradiation as well. Pulse assumes a very short irradiation.

incore_s.description: The residence time of the fuel salt in the core, in seconds

excore_s.description: The residence time of the fuel salt outside the core, in seconds

net_irrad_s.description: The total length of time the sample is irradiated, in seconds

decay_time.description: The length of time the sample decays.
